summary: BnHA Chapter 185: The Number Two Hero
title: BnHA Chapter 185: The Number Two Hero
body:
Previously on BnHA: Aizawa adopted Eri, basically, and she’s going to be living in U.A. for the time being with Mirio helping to look after her. The Pussycats (and Kouta!!) paid a visit to the 1-A dorms. Kouta had red Deku shoes and I died of cute. We learned about the JP Hero Billboard Chart, which updates its rankings twice a year. We then cut to the live event, where the top 10 heroes came out on stage and the new rankings were made official. There were not nearly enough ladies in the rankings, which is some bullshit, but tbh that’s a problem with superhero media in general, so BnHA isn’t exactly an outlier in this respect. Anyway, we met some new heroes like Old Man Samurai and Literally A Washing Machine, and found out that Kamui Woods had actually cracked the top 10, taking the #7 spot. My denim boi Supreme Best Jeanist moved up to number three, and we finally learned the identity of the former #3 and now #2 hero, Hawks. And of course Endeavor is now the official #1, and to celebrate he got a new costume. Hooray I guess.

Today on BnHA: The newly ranked top ten heroes share their comments with the crowd. Most of them are subdued, aware of the weight that’s fallen on their collective shoulders in the wake of All Might’s retirement. Finally Hawks gets fed up and drags the others for giving bland and “safe” answers during such a tumultuous time when the world is looking for more from the heroes they have left. We learn that Hawks, who is only 22, is basically a prodigy and the youngest hero ever to make the top ten. Having said his piece, he hands the mic to Endeavor, who simply says “watch me” and leaves it at that. Later on backstage, Endeavor confronts Hawks about putting him on the spot. Hawks confesses that he was trying to help him, and that with All Might gone the world needs a new iconic figure who can help put them at ease. He thinks Endeavor fits the bill. And also he wants to request a team-up with him regarding the Noumus! Remember them? Well speaking of, the chapter ends with a cut to an unknown location where a shadowy figure is speaking to a new “High End” Noumu who can fucking talk. So yeah. That’s a thing now.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 207 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)


  • oh look it’s a handy dandy chart



  • go fucking figure this thing is calculated by a stupid algorithm. JP Billboard team, I hate to break it to you, but your algorithm is sexist. fix that shit
  • I was so distracted by my righteous indignation last time that I just glanced over the fact that the washing machine dude is literally named Wash. omg. he is a leaf on the wind. watch how he –
  • lol now I want to go rewatch Firefly. anyway. so now a lady is talking
  • she says the reason they made the rankings announcement into a Big Fucking Deal this time around is that they judged this to be “a turning point”
  • she says it’s been 3 months since All Might’s retirement, and word on the street is that the world still lacks a new hero icon
  • well, I mean, yeah. that’s because you do lack one
  • oh my gawd you guys Hawks is doing stuff and saying stuff



  • could it be that Hawks… is a troll



  • I think it could indeed be that
  • and now each of the top ten heroes is going to get to make a statement
  • so first up is Ryuukyuu, and she’s thanking everyone and then saying that in truth she would have declined this rank if it was possible
  • um what



  • nah, you know what, fuck this humble modesty bullshit. you’re a badass bitch, and if you’d gone into that basement instead of FG y’all probably would have won a lot sooner to be honest. I’m sorry FG, I’m just stating facts. she can turn into a giant dragon. meanwhile your power is “if I get punched twenty billion times, I can hit back with exactly one stronger-than-usual punch.” c’mon buddy. c’mon
  • Ryuukyuu btw inquiring minds still want to know if you can breathe fire. ????
  • anyways so everyone is very moved and Crust says they all feel the same way. “that anguish in your heart. that feeling of self-reproach”
  • uggggh, just. I don’t like it, though? like, sure, of course you want to strive to always do better. but also remember that you’re setting an example and paving the way for the next generation of heroes that’s coming of age in one of the most chaotic eras to date. so maybe instead of being all meek, just say thank you and that you’ll continue to strive to do your best every day. that’s all. jesus
  • sorry guys I just have unexpectedly strong feelings about this. like, this is a very Japanese cultural thing and I get that but it doesn’t mean I agree
  • (ETA: well I feel validated now though because Hawks seems to feel the same way, as we will see)
  • now they’re passing the mic to Samurai Jack and all he says is, and I quote: “what I must do from now on has not changed”
  • I feel like this is the exact type of hero Tokoyami is going to grow up to be. probably will give that exact same speech word for word
  • HEY!! they passed the mic to Wash and I got all excited and then THEY DIDN’T SHOW ANYTHING. BOO
  • maybe he just doesn’t talk…? lol
  • (ETA: wait. was that him saying “WASH!” wtf. are you a pokemon)
  • Kamui says he’s gonna keep working hard as a part of Edgeshot’s team. oh shit I forgot all about that team-up. so is he like Edgeshot’s sidekick now or what?
  • (ETA: yeah I’m still confused about this but I’m not gonna bother trying to sort it out anymore lol)
  • Crust is very loudly regretting that he wasn’t there at Kamino on That Day
  • but Miruko has much more my type of attitude, and she’s calling out all the bad guys out there and saying “get ready to be pummeled by me.” ooh, yes. ooh I like her
  • meanwhile Hawks is standing there making faces at everyone’s speeches



  • Hawks you can’t just step in and become my favorite character when you’ve only had like one line. I’m not so easily bought! we established this already! you think you’re so fucking slick don’t you
  • now the lady is handing the mic to Edge and she says that if the rankings were based purely on approval ratings, he would have been number 3
  • interesting. I have to assume that’s because Endeav would be bumped down considerably if it was solely based on approval lol
  • oh my god



  • did Bakugou time travel from the future and has wings now. or what
  • OH SNAP THE AUDIENCE REACTION



  • lmao oh my god
  • welp, they’re either going to never do a ranking event like this again, or they’re going to always do it like this moving forward, and either way this one single soon-to-be viral moment is why
  • WOW ALL THE OTHER HEROES ARE JUST COOL WITH IT



  • (ETA: on a reread this statement is just dripping with hidden irony and I am fucking living for it. Hawks’s fucking secrets have secrets and here he is saying that he’s bad at hiding his feelings. this kid astounds me)
  • HAWKS STOP IT. YOU THINK YOU CAN JUST WIN MY HEART JUST LIKE THAT. SHUT UP. I HATE YOU. OH MY GOD YOU’RE PERFECT
  • OH MY GOD



  • HAWKS OUT HERE CORDIALLY GIVING MY BOY BEST SMARTEST HANDSOMEST JEANIST HIS DUE, OH MY GOD. FINE. THIS MAN CLEARLY KNOWS HIS WAY INTO MY HEART
  • and he says he would be second and Edge would be third and Endeavor would be 4th
  • wow Endeavor that’s actually higher than I expected. have you been making some strides lately after all?
  • Hawks says he thinks approval ratings are the most important metric right now
  • since the ratings would put Jeanist in first place, I agree completely. Hawks is right, everyone. listen to Hawks
  • wow he is up on that soapbox now without a care in the world



  • did this man really just tell everyone to cut the bullshit. that’s how I interpreted this. am I right. omg. because if it keeps going like this, I’m going to be in danger of him actually becoming my new fave and not just as a joke
  • yes, narrator-san. tell us more about Hawks



  • “the precocious man” sfasdf are you fucking serious
  • part of me is suddenly very upset though, because now I’m thinking that Mirio would have cracked the top ten even sooner and become the only hero ever to reach number one as a teenager. and he would have fucking deserved that glory too. but now it’s gonna be Izuku and Katsuki and Shouto instead. or ideally, for me, Deku+Kacchan as the #1 team and Shouto+Momo in the #2 spot. teams are the way of the future y’all
  • fff the precocious man. does this phrase perhaps sound less ridiculous in Japanese. I’m trying so hard not to laugh
  • (ETA: FWIW Mangastream translated this as “the man who goes too fast” and I feel like that works better, although they both basically mean the same thing)
  • now he’s flying back down and giving Endeavor the mic. “with lower approval ratings than me, the number one”
  • oh my god Endeavor. what do you even say to that
  • Hawks, you’re the first fully grown son I’ve adopted. Mirio and Tamaki don’t count because 18 years old = still a child, just FYI



  • I mean, he flew up into the air and told everyone to man up, basically. tough act indeed
  • well, time to see if Endeavor can be classy!



  • ffff I love this so much
  • he’s not saying much, actually
  • “apart from what that novice just tried to stir up… there is not much to say”
  • starting to see where Shouto got his chatty personality from
  • ooh



  • are y’all gonna delete me if I clap for Endeavor lol
  • I mean, that’s pretty much the perfect response. this guy is really the last person anyone wants to hear preach about anything. if you’re really trying to be a better person, show it with your actions. hell, Shouto’s said the same thing himself more than once
  • lmaooo



  • I love this audience so much. I can’t
  • look, Hawks is clapping



  • goddamn you Hawks. fine then, once this chapter is done I’m tracking down your omake page to learn more about you. and that’s become really difficult nowadays so you’d better appreciate the effort young man!
  • (ETA: actually to be fair this was one of the easier omakes to find. it’s almost as though the fandom fucking loves Hawks because he’s the fucking best)
  • lmao, again



  • did Peter Parker write this sign
  • ahhh, now here’s the Endeavor we all know and…
  • …well, here’s the Endeavor we all know



  • come on man. I was rooting for you. I’m still rooting for you. that was a good look out there just now. but you can’t just immediately start doing this kind of shit every time you’re out of the public eye. KEEP YOUR HANDS TO YOURSELF FOR FUCK’S SAKE
  • not that Hawks seems to be concerned in the slightest
  • he says everyone was just saying the same old boring things so he wanted to have a little extra impact
  • Endeavor is all “so you were testing me, huh?”
  • wtf, no. he was just being super duper extra dude
  • (ETA: actually no, I take it back. he was being extra, but Endeavor’s 100% right, that entire speech was all for the sake of putting him on the spot. he even made a point of calling attention to everyone’s respective approval ratings. because he wants Endeavor’s to be higher. he wants him to step up to the plate and become someone the people can put their faith in.)
  • so now he’s being all pacifying and waving a hand and saying that he helped him out and it all turned out well in the end
  • oh?



  • that strikes me as somewhat unusual, given his age. he’s prime “grew up during the Symbol of Peace era” material
  • (ETA: so now we know this most likely isn’t anything against All Might personally. it’s just that he never wanted to be a hero in the first place. “I’m not really a fan” doesn’t mean he dislikes him, it just means he didn’t grow up in awe of the man like so many others did. but despite this, he understands more than most just how crucial All Might’s role was as the Symbol of Peace.)
  • he says Endeavor isn’t an iconic presence like All Might was, but he thinks having a new leader right now is absolutely necessary
  • and he says he’s relieved, and that Endeavor was pretty cool
  • he was pretty cool. but I don’t like that he went and torched out and manhandled you and burned your nice jacket and everything behind closed doors afterward. that was not cool, and it shows a depressing lack of progress on his part
  • Endeavor’s thinking that he genuinely can’t tell if Hawks is sincere or if he’s just making fun of him
  • (ETA: yeah that’s an ongoing issue with Hawks lol. on my first readthrough I had no idea if he was being genuine here either. but it turns out he was!)
  • he’s asking if Hawks plans on becoming that leader
  • but Hawks is laughing and says he’s not of that caliber and he’d prefer to operate more freely in a lower rank
  • gosh it’s so hard being popular you guys



  • but instead of leaving, Hawks, who now has his cool glasses back on, says it’s time for “the main question”
  • HEY



  • YOU CAN’T JUST GO BRINGING UP IMPORTANT PLOT SHIT OUT OF NOWHERE SO CASUALLY AFTER ALL OF THAT BANTER! AND WITH THAT FLIPPANT AND UNCONCERNED EXPRESSION. HAWKS!! WHAT GIVES
  • – HOLY FUCKING SHIT!!!!!!



  • HOLY FUCKING SHIT!!!!!!
  • it’s a Noumu that can understand human speech. this Noumu still vaguely remembers being human. oh my god this is so fucked up. this is the Nina+Alexander of Noumus!? this is terrifying
  • and WHY DOES IT HAVE KUROGIRI’S FACE?!???? and is this a school!?? or an apartment? why does it look like they’re in a child’s room??? holy shit. oh my god I’m freaking out

(ETA: so the wallpaper on the room once again caught my notice on the reread, and there’s really only one possible answer, isn’t there? it’s not like this is the first time the series has gotten this dark. we’ve already had an arc centered around an imprisoned child. not to mention Horikoshi basically confirmed that Katsuki’s childhood friend with the wings was turned into another Noumu. and more recently during the babysitting arc, Seiji gave a long speech about how quirks are becoming stronger and stronger with each new generation and how it’s this whole big scientific phenomenon. so there’s actually a logical reason why the League might be targeting children to turn into Noumus. anyways at this point I’d say it’s a safe bet, and we’ll probably be hearing more about this.

I’ll also say this – this could lead to some extremely difficult decisions for Hawks down the line if he finds out about this whole thing. if he’s put in a situation where the only way to save a kid is to blow his cover, he pretty much has to do it, right? but what if it means being unable to save any future kids from the same fate because you no longer have access to that intel? well then that’s some dark fucking shit. but if the Basement arc taught us anything, it’s that this series sure as hell isn’t afraid to get dark. so yeah, I would not at all be surprised if a scenario like that comes up at some point in the future.)

  • don’t mind me, it’s just the first Main Plot Related thing we’ve had since chapter 94, basically. if you don’t count developments like Katsuki becoming one of The Squad and Tomura getting his hands on that Quirk-Be-Gone
  • please don’t let this end up being another thing like the Overhaul alliance which started out so promising and then veered off course so fast. I want League of Villains schemes. real League of Villains schemes again, goddammit!

(ETA: fff this arc was basically a fucking tease. mysterious Noumus with abilities belonging to individuals known to be currently incarcerated! with their quirks still intact as far as we know! though it did occur to me that Twice might have cloned some of them and AFO might have done some experimentation before he was captured? and another thing that only just occurred to me now is that we never found out who that doctor was or what his deal is. the one from chapter 59. he might be more involved in the Noumu-making than we knew. in fact we really don’t know much about the Noumu at all, and this arc only leaves us with more questions. basically I really liked it but I need to know more ugh!

and that of course is not even getting into the other LoV development that happens in this arc. but we’ll have plenty of time to talk about that later lol.)

  • oh my god I’m so hyped y’all someone hold me


BONUS: hey bnha fans it’s me ya boi


  • HE LIKES CHICKEN WHAT IS THIS. DOES THAT COUNT AS CANNIBALISM
  • so I looked up Mashin Hero Wataru and it looks like your basic mecha anime but there is indeed a character who is 100% a big bird dude. FALCO PUNCH
  • I love that when he originally told the staff “HEY GUYS THE NUMBER TWO HERO IS GONNA BE A BIG BIRD DUDE” the staff was all “…yay…” and then when he ended up having to change it they were just like “OH WHAT A SHAME” lol. “oh shit sensei that’s really rough man. oh but he’s hot now? oh… I guess we’ll just have to live with it”
  • and so I said this in the tags from yesterday’s post, but yeah, I would have loved if the number two hero had been female. I think a gender-swapped Hawks would have been badass. alternately I would have also accepted a gender-swapped Edgeshot or even Best Jeanist. but basically the ratio of male to female heroes is a real bummer for me in a series that I by and large love otherwise. I really hope that this changes with Izuku’s generation and Momo or Ochako (or Mina! or Tsuyu! or Kendou! there are so many cool girls) make it into the top 3
  • lastly, I’m kind of surprised that his actual name is still apparently a secret. is it going to be some big reveal or something? or maybe Horikoshi just hasn’t settled on one yet, given how much thought he typically puts into names, and how complex a character he is. but I’m curious now dammit

trail.content_raw:
Previously on BnHA: Aizawa adopted Eri, basically, and she’s going to be living in U.A. for the time being with Mirio helping to look after her. The Pussycats (and Kouta!!) paid a visit to the 1-A dorms. Kouta had red Deku shoes and I died of cute. We learned about the JP Hero Billboard Chart, which updates its rankings twice a year. We then cut to the live event, where the top 10 heroes came out on stage and the new rankings were made official. There were not nearly enough ladies in the rankings, which is some bullshit, but tbh that’s a problem with superhero media in general, so BnHA isn’t exactly an outlier in this respect. Anyway, we met some new heroes like Old Man Samurai and Literally A Washing Machine, and found out that Kamui Woods had actually cracked the top 10, taking the #7 spot. My denim boi Supreme Best Jeanist moved up to number three, and we finally learned the identity of the former #3 and now #2 hero, Hawks. And of course Endeavor is now the official #1, and to celebrate he got a new costume. Hooray I guess.

Today on BnHA: The newly ranked top ten heroes share their comments with the crowd. Most of them are subdued, aware of the weight that’s fallen on their collective shoulders in the wake of All Might’s retirement. Finally Hawks gets fed up and drags the others for giving bland and “safe” answers during such a tumultuous time when the world is looking for more from the heroes they have left. We learn that Hawks, who is only 22, is basically a prodigy and the youngest hero ever to make the top ten. Having said his piece, he hands the mic to Endeavor, who simply says “watch me” and leaves it at that. Later on backstage, Endeavor confronts Hawks about putting him on the spot. Hawks confesses that he was trying to help him, and that with All Might gone the world needs a new iconic figure who can help put them at ease. He thinks Endeavor fits the bill. And also he wants to request a team-up with him regarding the Noumus! Remember them? Well speaking of, the chapter ends with a cut to an unknown location where a shadowy figure is speaking to a new “High End” Noumu who can fucking talk. So yeah. That’s a thing now.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 207 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

(ETA: fff this arc was basically a fucking tease. mysterious Noumus with abilities belonging to individuals known to be currently incarcerated! with their quirks still intact as far as we know! though it did occur to me that Twice might have cloned some of them and AFO might have done some experimentation before he was captured? and another thing that only just occurred to me now is that we never found out who that doctor was or what his deal is. the one from chapter 59. he might be more involved in the Noumu-making than we knew. in fact we really don’t know much about the Noumu at all, and this arc only leaves us with more questions. basically I really liked it but I need to know more ugh!

and that of course is not even getting into the other LoV development that happens in this arc. but we’ll have plenty of time to talk about that later lol.)

  • oh my god I’m so hyped y’all someone hold me


BONUS: hey bnha fans it’s me ya boi


  • HE LIKES CHICKEN WHAT IS THIS. DOES THAT COUNT AS CANNIBALISM
  • so I looked up Mashin Hero Wataru and it looks like your basic mecha anime but there is indeed a character who is 100% a big bird dude. FALCO PUNCH
  • I love that when he originally told the staff “HEY GUYS THE NUMBER TWO HERO IS GONNA BE A BIG BIRD DUDE” the staff was all “…yay…” and then when he ended up having to change it they were just like “OH WHAT A SHAME” lol. “oh shit sensei that’s really rough man. oh but he’s hot now? oh… I guess we’ll just have to live with it”
  • and so I said this in the tags from yesterday’s post, but yeah, I would have loved if the number two hero had been female. I think a gender-swapped Hawks would have been badass. alternately I would have also accepted a gender-swapped Edgeshot or even Best Jeanist. but basically the ratio of male to female heroes is a real bummer for me in a series that I by and large love otherwise. I really hope that this changes with Izuku’s generation and Momo or Ochako (or Mina! or Tsuyu! or Kendou! there are so many cool girls) make it into the top 3
  • lastly, I’m kind of surprised that his actual name is still apparently a secret. is it going to be some big reveal or something? or maybe Horikoshi just hasn’t settled on one yet, given how much thought he typically puts into names, and how complex a character he is. but I’m curious now dammit
trail.content:
Previously on BnHA: Aizawa adopted Eri, basically, and she’s going to be living in U.A. for the time being with Mirio helping to look after her. The Pussycats (and Kouta!!) paid a visit to the 1-A dorms. Kouta had red Deku shoes and I died of cute. We learned about the JP Hero Billboard Chart, which updates its rankings twice a year. We then cut to the live event, where the top 10 heroes came out on stage and the new rankings were made official. There were not nearly enough ladies in the rankings, which is some bullshit, but tbh that’s a problem with superhero media in general, so BnHA isn’t exactly an outlier in this respect. Anyway, we met some new heroes like Old Man Samurai and Literally A Washing Machine, and found out that Kamui Woods had actually cracked the top 10, taking the #7 spot. My denim boi Supreme Best Jeanist moved up to number three, and we finally learned the identity of the former #3 and now #2 hero, Hawks. And of course Endeavor is now the official #1, and to celebrate he got a new costume. Hooray I guess.

Today on BnHA: The newly ranked top ten heroes share their comments with the crowd. Most of them are subdued, aware of the weight that’s fallen on their collective shoulders in the wake of All Might’s retirement. Finally Hawks gets fed up and drags the others for giving bland and “safe” answers during such a tumultuous time when the world is looking for more from the heroes they have left. We learn that Hawks, who is only 22, is basically a prodigy and the youngest hero ever to make the top ten. Having said his piece, he hands the mic to Endeavor, who simply says “watch me” and leaves it at that. Later on backstage, Endeavor confronts Hawks about putting him on the spot. Hawks confesses that he was trying to help him, and that with All Might gone the world needs a new iconic figure who can help put them at ease. He thinks Endeavor fits the bill. And also he wants to request a team-up with him regarding the Noumus! Remember them? Well speaking of, the chapter ends with a cut to an unknown location where a shadowy figure is speaking to a new “High End” Noumu who can fucking talk. So yeah. That’s a thing now.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 207 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

  • go fucking figure this thing is calculated by a stupid algorithm. JP Billboard team, I hate to break it to you, but your algorithm is sexist. fix that shit
  • I was so distracted by my righteous indignation last time that I just glanced over the fact that the washing machine dude is literally named Wash. omg. he is a leaf on the wind. watch how he –
  • lol now I want to go rewatch Firefly. anyway. so now a lady is talking
  • she says the reason they made the rankings announcement into a Big Fucking Deal this time around is that they judged this to be “a turning point”
  • she says it’s been 3 months since All Might’s retirement, and word on the street is that the world still lacks a new hero icon
  • well, I mean, yeah. that’s because you do lack one
  • oh my gawd you guys Hawks is doing stuff and saying stuff



  • could it be that Hawks… is a troll



  • I think it could indeed be that
  • and now each of the top ten heroes is going to get to make a statement
  • so first up is Ryuukyuu, and she’s thanking everyone and then saying that in truth she would have declined this rank if it was possible
  • um what



  • nah, you know what, fuck this humble modesty bullshit. you’re a badass bitch, and if you’d gone into that basement instead of FG y’all probably would have won a lot sooner to be honest. I’m sorry FG, I’m just stating facts. she can turn into a giant dragon. meanwhile your power is “if I get punched twenty billion times, I can hit back with exactly one stronger-than-usual punch.” c’mon buddy. c’mon
  • Ryuukyuu btw inquiring minds still want to know if you can breathe fire. ????
  • anyways so everyone is very moved and Crust says they all feel the same way. “that anguish in your heart. that feeling of self-reproach”
  • uggggh, just. I don’t like it, though? like, sure, of course you want to strive to always do better. but also remember that you’re setting an example and paving the way for the next generation of heroes that’s coming of age in one of the most chaotic eras to date. so maybe instead of being all meek, just say thank you and that you’ll continue to strive to do your best every day. that’s all. jesus
  • sorry guys I just have unexpectedly strong feelings about this. like, this is a very Japanese cultural thing and I get that but it doesn’t mean I agree
  • (ETA: well I feel validated now though because Hawks seems to feel the same way, as we will see)
  • now they’re passing the mic to Samurai Jack and all he says is, and I quote: “what I must do from now on has not changed”
  • I feel like this is the exact type of hero Tokoyami is going to grow up to be. probably will give that exact same speech word for word
  • HEY!! they passed the mic to Wash and I got all excited and then THEY DIDN’T SHOW ANYTHING. BOO
  • maybe he just doesn’t talk…? lol
  • (ETA: wait. was that him saying “WASH!” wtf. are you a pokemon)
  • Kamui says he’s gonna keep working hard as a part of Edgeshot’s team. oh shit I forgot all about that team-up. so is he like Edgeshot’s sidekick now or what?
  • (ETA: yeah I’m still confused about this but I’m not gonna bother trying to sort it out anymore lol)
  • Crust is very loudly regretting that he wasn’t there at Kamino on That Day
  • but Miruko has much more my type of attitude, and she’s calling out all the bad guys out there and saying “get ready to be pummeled by me.” ooh, yes. ooh I like her
  • meanwhile Hawks is standing there making faces at everyone’s speeches



  • Hawks you can’t just step in and become my favorite character when you’ve only had like one line. I’m not so easily bought! we established this already! you think you’re so fucking slick don’t you
  • now the lady is handing the mic to Edge and she says that if the rankings were based purely on approval ratings, he would have been number 3
  • interesting. I have to assume that’s because Endeav would be bumped down considerably if it was solely based on approval lol
  • oh my god



  • did Bakugou time travel from the future and has wings now. or what
  • OH SNAP THE AUDIENCE REACTION



  • lmao oh my god
  • welp, they’re either going to never do a ranking event like this again, or they’re going to always do it like this moving forward, and either way this one single soon-to-be viral moment is why
  • WOW ALL THE OTHER HEROES ARE JUST COOL WITH IT



  • (ETA: on a reread this statement is just dripping with hidden irony and I am fucking living for it. Hawks’s fucking secrets have secrets and here he is saying that he’s bad at hiding his feelings. this kid astounds me)
  • HAWKS STOP IT. YOU THINK YOU CAN JUST WIN MY HEART JUST LIKE THAT. SHUT UP. I HATE YOU. OH MY GOD YOU’RE PERFECT
  • OH MY GOD



  • HAWKS OUT HERE CORDIALLY GIVING MY BOY BEST SMARTEST HANDSOMEST JEANIST HIS DUE, OH MY GOD. FINE. THIS MAN CLEARLY KNOWS HIS WAY INTO MY HEART
  • and he says he would be second and Edge would be third and Endeavor would be 4th
  • wow Endeavor that’s actually higher than I expected. have you been making some strides lately after all?
  • Hawks says he thinks approval ratings are the most important metric right now
  • since the ratings would put Jeanist in first place, I agree completely. Hawks is right, everyone. listen to Hawks
  • wow he is up on that soapbox now without a care in the world



  • did this man really just tell everyone to cut the bullshit. that’s how I interpreted this. am I right. omg. because if it keeps going like this, I’m going to be in danger of him actually becoming my new fave and not just as a joke
  • yes, narrator-san. tell us more about Hawks



  • “the precocious man” sfasdf are you fucking serious
  • part of me is suddenly very upset though, because now I’m thinking that Mirio would have cracked the top ten even sooner and become the only hero ever to reach number one as a teenager. and he would have fucking deserved that glory too. but now it’s gonna be Izuku and Katsuki and Shouto instead. or ideally, for me, Deku+Kacchan as the #1 team and Shouto+Momo in the #2 spot. teams are the way of the future y’all
  • fff the precocious man. does this phrase perhaps sound less ridiculous in Japanese. I’m trying so hard not to laugh
  • (ETA: FWIW Mangastream translated this as “the man who goes too fast” and I feel like that works better, although they both basically mean the same thing)
  • now he’s flying back down and giving Endeavor the mic. “with lower approval ratings than me, the number one”
  • oh my god Endeavor. what do you even say to that
  • Hawks, you’re the first fully grown son I’ve adopted. Mirio and Tamaki don’t count because 18 years old = still a child, just FYI



  • I mean, he flew up into the air and told everyone to man up, basically. tough act indeed
  • well, time to see if Endeavor can be classy!



  • ffff I love this so much
  • he’s not saying much, actually
  • “apart from what that novice just tried to stir up… there is not much to say”
  • starting to see where Shouto got his chatty personality from
  • ooh



  • are y’all gonna delete me if I clap for Endeavor lol
  • I mean, that’s pretty much the perfect response. this guy is really the last person anyone wants to hear preach about anything. if you’re really trying to be a better person, show it with your actions. hell, Shouto’s said the same thing himself more than once
  • lmaooo



  • I love this audience so much. I can’t
  • look, Hawks is clapping



  • goddamn you Hawks. fine then, once this chapter is done I’m tracking down your omake page to learn more about you. and that’s become really difficult nowadays so you’d better appreciate the effort young man!
  • (ETA: actually to be fair this was one of the easier omakes to find. it’s almost as though the fandom fucking loves Hawks because he’s the fucking best)
  • lmao, again



  • did Peter Parker write this sign
  • ahhh, now here’s the Endeavor we all know and…
  • …well, here’s the Endeavor we all know



  • come on man. I was rooting for you. I’m still rooting for you. that was a good look out there just now. but you can’t just immediately start doing this kind of shit every time you’re out of the public eye. KEEP YOUR HANDS TO YOURSELF FOR FUCK’S SAKE
  • not that Hawks seems to be concerned in the slightest
  • he says everyone was just saying the same old boring things so he wanted to have a little extra impact
  • Endeavor is all “so you were testing me, huh?”
  • wtf, no. he was just being super duper extra dude
  • (ETA: actually no, I take it back. he was being extra, but Endeavor’s 100% right, that entire speech was all for the sake of putting him on the spot. he even made a point of calling attention to everyone’s respective approval ratings. because he wants Endeavor’s to be higher. he wants him to step up to the plate and become someone the people can put their faith in.)
  • so now he’s being all pacifying and waving a hand and saying that he helped him out and it all turned out well in the end
  • oh?



  • that strikes me as somewhat unusual, given his age. he’s prime “grew up during the Symbol of Peace era” material

  • HEY



  • YOU CAN’T JUST GO BRINGING UP IMPORTANT PLOT SHIT OUT OF NOWHERE SO CASUALLY AFTER ALL OF THAT BANTER! AND WITH THAT FLIPPANT AND UNCONCERNED EXPRESSION. HAWKS!! WHAT GIVES

(ETA: so the wallpaper on the room once again caught my notice on the reread, and there’s really only one possible answer, isn’t there? it’s not like this is the first time the series has gotten this dark. we’ve already had an arc centered around an imprisoned child. not to mention Horikoshi basically confirmed that Katsuki’s childhood friend with the wings was turned into another Noumu. and more recently during the babysitting arc, Seiji gave a long speech about how quirks are becoming stronger and stronger with each new generation and how it’s this whole big scientific phenomenon. so there’s actually a logical reason why the League might be targeting children to turn into Noumus. anyways at this point I’d say it’s a safe bet, and we’ll probably be hearing more about this.

I’ll also say this – this could lead to some extremely difficult decisions for Hawks down the line if he finds out about this whole thing. if he’s put in a situation where the only way to save a kid is to blow his cover, he pretty much has to do it, right? but what if it means being unable to save any future kids from the same fate because you no longer have access to that intel? well then that’s some dark fucking shit. but if the Basement arc taught us anything, it’s that this series sure as hell isn’t afraid to get dark. so yeah, I would not at all be surprised if a scenario like that comes up at some point in the future.)
